snippet: The Los Angeles International Airport shooting that left one Transportation Security Administration official dead has security experts re-examining strategy for making airports safe.
abstract: Los Angeles International Airport shooting that left one Transportation Security Administration official dead has security experts re-examining strategy for making airports safe; they say there no obvious solutions and that extending any security perimeter raises other problems.

byline.original: By MATTHEW L. WALD and JENNIFER MEDINA
byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald reported from Washington, and Jennifer Medina from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles International Airport shooting that left one Transportation Security Administration official dead has security experts re-examining strategy for making airports safe.

headline.main: After Los Angeles Airport Shooting, No Easy Answers on Security Strategies
headline.print_headline: No Easy Answers on Whether to Revise Airport Security Strategies
